channel.title: Incense
channel.description:
does anyone on these forums burn it regularly? i was going to try and make some tonite becuz i have some spices and stuff but im not sure which i should use, i have some sage and thyme which i know i will use, but what else can i use in my incense? and what should i burn it in? i really don't have an incense burner so what should i burn it in?
EDIT: oh fuck wrong section

item.title: Incense
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

[quote=“Casey., post:4, topic:154994”]Every time I go to the mall I buy a couple packs at Spencers.
Normally I buy marijuana and sex on a beach.[/quote]
Why the fuck would someone buy something of the scent they want to cover up…?

Read full topic

item.title: Incense
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

.Flair:

It covers up the smell of pot like a charm

Lol yeah around here, if you burn incence it’s a instant give away that you are a big stoner.

item.title: Incense
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Every time I go to the mall I buy a couple packs at Spencers.
Normally I buy marijuana and sex on a beach.

I don’t know how to make them, but I’ve made some makeshift ones buy putting spices/herbs in some paper, wrapping thin, and lighting.

Read full topic

item.title: Incense
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

Weeelll, I don’t make my own incense but, I know where to burn it. If your house is littered with steel plates, use one of those, flat rocks are fine, ceramic pots are ok, holding is good if you can catch the ash in something, and I use stoneware with little holes in it.
OFFTOPIC: Also, get camfurs(terrible spelling I know), they are these really cool Indian white blocks that burn really really well. They are like burning paper but you can blow it out.

Read full topic
